Q1.text: What is your first priority as ruler of the Dwarven Kingdom?

options.text: Invest in reinforced tunnels (strengthen before expanding)
Militarize the guards to secure mines
Push aggressive mining (dig deeper, faster)

Q2.text: You shore up tunnels and invest in infrastructure. Continue?

options.text: Proceed carefully with expansion

Q3.text: You deploy guards throughout the mines. Deploy them now?

options.text: Deploy guards across tunnels

Q4.text: You push miners to work faster and deeper. Continue?

options.text: Order miners to keep digging

Q5.text: Despite reinforcements, a massive underground fault is discovered beneath the capital. How do you respond?

options.text: Exploit it carefully ‚Äî send elite engineers to mine and study the fault
Seal the fault permanently (close the affected shafts for safety)
Guard and study slowly ‚Äî secure the area and research it over time

Q6.text: With guards stationed throughout the mines, productivity rises ‚Äî but the atmosphere grows tense. One night a violent clash breaks out in a tunnel (a guard is killed, the tunnel is sealed). How do you handle the crisis?

options.text: Hold a public trial ‚Äî investigate and deliver justice openly
Enforce harsh military justice ‚Äî make an example of the miners
Reduce military presence and restore civilian oversight

Q9.text: üîê KEYWORD REQUIRED: Your chief engineer asks for the operation keyword to begin careful exploitation (hint: who leads the engineering team?).

Q10.text: üèÜ OPERATION: Fault sealed and shafts closed. Type ANY to continue

Q11.text: You secure the area and begin a slow study. Type ANY to continue

Q12.text: RIDDLE: The court asks ‚Äî 'What binds a community more surely than law yet cannot be seen?' (Hint: 5 letters)

Q13.text: üß† MINING BONUS RIDDLE: You must name the engineering concept that prevents collapse (1 word)

Q14.text: After addressing the fault and recent unrest, you must set long-term policy. Which will you choose?

options.text: Invest in living conditions (build rest halls and housing for miners)
Support industry ‚Äî prioritize output over welfare

Q15.text: üèÜ ROUND COMPLETE ‚Äî The Dwarven Kingdom stabilizes for now. Type ANY to proceed to Event 3: The Dwarven Doctrine.

Q16.text: A new opportunity appears: a rich vein discovered near the sealed fault. How do you act?

options.text: Exploit it carefully using the lessons learned
Force extraction immediately to reap rewards

Q17.text: EVENT 3: The Dwarven Doctrine ‚Äî With the immediate crisis resolved, the council gathers to define the Dwarven way forward. What defines the dwarven path?

options.text: Wealth and Trade ‚Äî Turn the mountain into a trade empire.
Craftsmanship Above All ‚Äî Focus on builders, engineers, and artisans.
Fortress of Stone ‚Äî Prepare for war and maintain massive defenses.
Regulate Foreign Presence ‚Äî Manage trade and foreign merchants carefully.

Q18.text: Wealth and Trade ‚Äî Markets expand rapidly, but foreign merchants gain influence inside dwarven cities. How do you respond?

options.text: Regulate foreign presence (tight rules and oversight)
Tax foreign merchants heavily to fill the treasury
Let prosperity run its course (minimal intervention)

Q19.text: Craftsmanship Above All ‚Äî You prioritize artisans, guilds, and design. Do you open guild knowledge to outsiders?

options.text: Share selected knowledge for profit and alliances
Guard dwarven secrets ‚Äî remain unrivaled but isolated

Q20.text: Fortress of Stone ‚Üí The Living Fortress is completed. Maintaining it drains resources. Your command?

options.text: Boost military spending to keep defenses immaculate
Convert parts of the fortress to civic uses to reduce cost (dual-use structures)

Q21.text: Regulate Foreign Presence ‚Äî A delegation from the surface asks for access. How will you proceed?

options.text: Offer limited trade licenses under royal permission
Strengthen diplomatic oversight ‚Äî tighter rules and monitoring
Nationalize key assets ‚Äî bring foreign-owned infrastructure under state control

Q23.text: Tax Foreign Merchants Heavily ‚Äî The treasury swells but whispers spread. How do you allocate and manage the revenue?

options.text: Use taxes to fund state expansion (infrastructure and projects)
Increase tax enforcement to squeeze more revenue from merchants
Offer tax relief in exchange for demonstrated loyalty
Share knowledge for profit (sell blueprints, open workshops)
Open the Royal Reserves to buy materials for the people

Q26.text: Open the Royal Reserves: Use the crown's private gold to buy materials from surface traders. This relieves the people but drains the treasury. Type ANY to continue.

Q40.text: Convert Defenses into Dual-Use Structures ‚Äî Walls become living spaces, training halls, and markets. How will you adapt the Living Fortress?

options.text: Reduce military spending and repurpose funds
Train a new generation of dwarves (craftsmanship & trade)
Maintain essential maintenance and keep dual-use balance

Q41.text: Reduce Military Spending ‚Äî Life improves, but defenses weaken slightly. You must allocate the surplus. Where does the money go?

options.text: Invest in Trade Guilds to stimulate commerce
Renovate the Great Hall to restore cultural prestige
Bolster secret intelligence to protect interests cheaply

Q47.text: Invest in Trade Guilds ‚Äî Establish new merchant routes and subsidize local artisans to maximize economic growth. Type ANY to continue.

Q48.text: Renovate the Great Hall ‚Äî Use the funds to restore monuments and cultural prestige. Type ANY to continue.

Q49.text: Bolster Secret Intelligence ‚Äî Fund a network of hidden observers to protect the realm at low visible cost. Type ANY to continue.

Q43.text: Train a New Generation of Dwarves ‚Äî The new smiths must create a final masterpiece for the 'Trial of the Anvil'. Resource shortages force a single approach. How will they prove mastery?

options.text: Refine Ancient Techniques ‚Äî perfect traditional methods
Mass Production Study ‚Äî design efficient tools to jumpstart growth
Experimental Alloys ‚Äî embrace risky innovation with volatile crystals

Q50.text: Refine Ancient Techniques ‚Äî Focus on perfecting traditional methods. Type ANY to continue.

Q51.text: Mass Production Study ‚Äî Task smiths with efficient tool designs to jumpstart growth. Type ANY to continue.

Q52.text: Experimental Alloys ‚Äî Encourage daring alloy experiments; risky but potentially revolutionary. Type ANY to continue.

Q24.text: Let Prosperity Run Its Course ‚Äî The market grows with little interference. Type ANY to continue.

Q25.text: Strengthened oversight is enacted. Type ANY to confirm the new regulations.

Q33.text: Share Knowledge for Profit ‚Äî The kingdom opens workshops and sells blueprints. How do you control access?

options.text: License knowledge selectively ‚Äî restrict critical techniques
Restrict sensitive knowledge ‚Äî protect core secrets and sell little

Q34.text: License Knowledge Selectively ‚Äî Workshops operate under royal license. Type ANY to proceed.

Q36.text: üèÜ EVENT 3 COMPLETE ‚Äî The council's decision defines the Dwarven Doctrine for this era. Proceed to the Final Trial or investigate a newly reported rich vein?

options.text: Proceed to the Final Trial (riddles)
Investigate the rich vein before the Trial

R1.text: üß† RIDDLE 1: I increase when you build nothing, decrease when you build too much, and disappear when you build blindly.

R2.text: üß† RIDDLE 2 (TRANSPORT): In our city, nothing moves without me, yet no one ever travels on me. When I am misjudged, traffic jams appear underground. What was misjudged?

R3.text: üß† RIDDLE 3 (DRAINAGE): Water never asks permission. It follows me every time. Build me wrong, and homes flood. Build me right, and no one notices. What am I?

R4.text: üß† RIDDLE 4 (CITY MOVEMENT): Guards widen me to calm trade. Narrow me, and control becomes easier. I decide who meets whom. What am I?

R6.text: üß† RIDDLE 6: I move slower than armies, faster than laws, and once I start, even kings evacuate.

R7.text: üß† RIDDLE 7: SimCity rewards me early, punishes me late, and hides my limit completely.

R8.text: üß† RIDDLE 8: The Dwarves blamed workers for me, generals blamed spies, but engineers blamed time.

R9.text: üß† RIDDLE 9: I am strongest when invisible, weakest when displayed, and fatal when ignored.

R10.text: üß† RIDDLE 10: In peace I am a statistic. In war I am a weapon. In collapse I am irrelevant.

R11.text: üß† RIDDLE 11: The city grew richer every year, yet poorer every decade. I was never taxed.

R12.text: üß† RIDDLE 12: I increase economy today, decrease health tomorrow, and rewrite history next generation.

R13.text: üß† RIDDLE 13: The Dwarves sealed me once, and the city survived. They opened me again, and legends were born‚Äîor buried.

R14.text: üß† RIDDLE 14: SimCity lets you pause me, but reality never does. Dwarves respect me more than kings.

R15.text: üß† RIDDLE 15: I do not exist in maps, only in meetings, yet wars are fought because of me.

R16.text: üß† RIDDLE 16: The deeper the city went, the smaller I became, until progress stopped entirely.

R17.text: üß† RIDDLE 17: The council ignored me because I had no voice, but when I finally spoke, the mountain answered.

R18.text: üß† RIDDLE 18: SimCity calls me a slider. The Dwarves called me a curse. Engineers called me inevitable.

R19.text: üß† RIDDLE 19: I grow faster than cities, slower than disasters, and never where planned.

R20.text: üß† RIDDLE 20 (FINAL BOSS): When all four stats are high, I decide whether the city lives. When all four are low, I decide whether it dies quietly or violently.

E1_FAIL.text: üëé HARSH CRACKDOWN ‚Äî The miners revolt in secret; unrest spreads. Type ANY to accept the collapse.
